API_Description: Registers a new review process for a document, allowing specified users to participate in the review.
API_Description_Reason: The method name 'registerReview' suggests it is used to initiate or register a review process. The parameters such as 'invitees', 'cc', 'bcc', and 'distributionMethod' imply that it involves setting up a review with multiple participants.
Returns: A boolean indicating whether the review registration was successful.
Returns_Reason: Typically, methods that perform an action like registration return a boolean to indicate success or failure.

doc.description: The document object that is to be reviewed.
doc.description_reason: The parameter name 'doc' suggests it refers to the document involved in the review process.
doc.type_reason: The term 'doc' implies a complex data structure, likely a document object.

initiator.description: The user or entity initiating the review process.
initiator.description_reason: The term 'initiator' typically refers to the person or entity that starts a process.
initiator.type_reason: The type is unspecified, but it likely represents a user or entity identifier.

initScript.description: A script or set of instructions to initialize the review process.
initScript.description_reason: The name 'initScript' suggests it is a script executed at the start of the review.
initScript.type_reason: Scripts are usually represented as strings of code or instructions.

invitees.description: A comma-separated list of users invited to participate in the review.
invitees.description_reason: The term 'invitees' implies a list of participants for the review.
invitees.type_reason: A list of users is often represented as a string, especially if it is comma-separated.

cc.description: A comma-separated list of users to be copied on the review notifications.
cc.description_reason: The 'cc' parameter is commonly used to specify additional recipients in communication contexts.
cc.type_reason: A list of users is often represented as a string, especially if it is comma-separated.

bcc.description: A comma-separated list of users to be blind copied on the review notifications.
bcc.description_reason: The 'bcc' parameter is commonly used to specify hidden recipients in communication contexts.
bcc.type_reason: A list of users is often represented as a string, especially if it is comma-separated.

ui.description: A flag indicating whether the user interface should be displayed during the review registration.
ui.description_reason: The 'ui' parameter likely controls the visibility of the user interface.
ui.type_reason: Flags are typically represented as boolean values.

selfDestruct.description: A flag indicating whether the review should automatically terminate after a certain condition is met.
selfDestruct.description_reason: The term 'selfDestruct' suggests an automatic termination feature.
selfDestruct.type_reason: Flags are typically represented as boolean values.

id.description: A unique identifier for the review process.
id.description_reason: The 'id' parameter is likely used to uniquely identify the review instance.
id.type_reason: Identifiers are often represented as strings.

source.description: The origin or source of the document or review request.
source.description_reason: The term 'source' suggests the origin of the document or request.
source.type_reason: Sources are typically represented as strings.

driver.description: The mechanism or tool used to facilitate the review process.
driver.description_reason: The term 'driver' implies a component that facilitates or manages the review.
driver.type_reason: Drivers or mechanisms are often represented as strings.

requireSave.description: A flag indicating whether saving the document is required before starting the review.
requireSave.description_reason: The 'requireSave' parameter likely enforces a save operation before proceeding.
requireSave.type_reason: Flags are typically represented as boolean values.

distributionMethod.description: The method used to distribute the review document to participants.
distributionMethod.description_reason: The term 'distributionMethod' suggests the way the document is shared with reviewers.
distributionMethod.type_reason: Methods or strategies are often represented as strings.

versionInfo.description: The version number of the document or review process.
versionInfo.description_reason: The 'versionInfo' parameter likely tracks the version of the document or review.
versionInfo.type_reason: Version numbers are typically represented as numeric values.

accessLevel.description: The level of access granted to participants in the review.
accessLevel.description_reason: The 'accessLevel' parameter likely controls permissions for reviewers.
accessLevel.type_reason: Access levels are often represented as numeric values to denote different permission tiers.

bezelMessage.description: A message displayed to users during the review process.
bezelMessage.description_reason: The term 'bezelMessage' suggests a message shown in the user interface.
bezelMessage.type_reason: Messages are typically represented as strings.

displayWelcome.description: A flag indicating whether a welcome message should be displayed at the start of the review.
displayWelcome.description_reason: The 'displayWelcome' parameter likely controls the display of an introductory message.
displayWelcome.type_reason: Flags are typically represented as boolean values.
